channel.title: Hallessandro' Adventures
channel.description: Developed with Jekyll and Github Pages

item.title: #17 - Quick Tip - Array.prototype.concat()
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Hello everyone, I’m back, this time with a quick tip about how to use the concat() method to merge arrays in JavaScript, so no time to waste, let’s get started.

item.title: #16 - Meaningful Names - What I Learned With Clean Code
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Hi everyone, I’m back for a new post, this time with something a little different. In this post we will talk about the chapter “Meaningful Names” of the book Clean Code, write by Robert Cecil Martin also know as Uncle Bob.

item.title: #15 - Creating charts with JavaScript using PlotlyJS
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Charts can be a great way to present information of a way that a reader can be understanding fast and easy. For example, if you want to say that in March your sales were 20% higher than in February, instead to say this in one or two paragraphs of text you can show this in a simple chart bar like this:

item.title: #14 - How to use *args and **kwargs
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Hi guys, my name is Hallessandro, I am a software developer that currently works and live in Brazil, and today in this post let’s talk again about Python, this time how to use *args and **kwargs in our Python functions.

item.title: #13 - How to create a HTTP server with Python
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Hey guys, my name is Hallessandro, I am a software developer that currently works and live in Brazil, and in this post I will show you how to create a HTTP server using Python, so let’s get start.

item.title: #12 - A Brief Introduction of Strings in Python
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Hey guys, today I will talk about how to use strings In Python, and some useful methods available. Strings in python are exactly equal a strings in other languages like Java or Javascript, a sequence of one or more characters.

item.title: #11 - Johnny Five - Controlling a Arduino Uno with JavaScript
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Sup guys, I’m back, this time to talk about Johnny Five, a JavaScript plataform for IoT and Robotic. In this post we will see how to control a Led by HTTP request.

item.title: #10 - Criação e integração de um bot ao RocketChat
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Olá terráqueos, no post de hoje vamos ver como criar um bot utilizando o Hubot, um robô customizável e open source, criado e distribuído pelo GitHub.

item.title: #9 - How to build a Chatbot with DialogFlow
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Hi guys, today I will talk about a very interesting thing called chatbot and how build one with DialogFlow, so I hope you enjoy.

item.title: #8 - JavaScript - Spread and Rest Operators
item.dc:creator: Hallessandro D´villa
item.description: Hi guys, today I have a quick tip where I will show you another cool functionality of modern JavaScript, the operators spread and rest. This little guys has been implanted in ES6 and bellow is a description of each one.
